result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaun L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shaun L Johnson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shaun L Johnson was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent including sexual offender treatment pursuant to sex offender risk assessment. If assessment shows defendant is a low risk, he is not required to participate in any other sex offender treatment. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Defendant must get his GED or HSED. No contact with the victim. No contact with any known prostitutes. Defendant must provide a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

timeConds.notes:
The balance is stayed.
Concurrent with: 13CM2636

Defendant Shaun L Johnson in court with attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Defendant Shaun L Johnson in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Parties are in receipt of PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties, but defense noted that the recommendation for probation was to run consecutive but probation cannot run consecutive to each other. The State recommends 3 yrs probation w/6 mos RCJ but probation must be run concurrent. Defense recommends 2 yrs probation in 14CF3 w/RCJ=CFTS and 1 yr probation w/9 mos RCJ I/S in 13CF2636. Deft addresses the Court.

Defendant Shaun L Johnson in court with attorney Carl B Johnson.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Defense files motion for review of bond and is asking for a signature bond. Defendant has an active warrant with hold out of the State of Florida as well. The State objects - the State spoke to the prosecuting attorney in Miami and there is a nationwide extradition. There is an active warrant with nationwide extradition and the State of Florida intends to extradite. The ADA in Miami has been in touch with Inv. Hipper regarding that matter.

BTC: bond modification is denied. Sentencing date rmains as scheduled

Defendant Shaun L Johnson in court with attorney Carl Bradford Johnson.  Defendant Shaun L Johnson in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
The State has not been able to adequately research motion filed by the State and evidence has just recently come to fruition. Defense indicates they are prepared to proceed. Deft is being held on a hold through the State of Florida.
Based upon the information that the defense just received, defense indicates that they would have proceeded with whatever information they had and that the defendant is not willing to waive his demand for speedy trial.

Defense makes another speedy trial demand

BTC: The Court finds that it is not in the interest of justice to honor the speedy trial demand as the information that has recently come to fruition is necessary information. The Court finds good cause to adjourn the trial.

The State has not had an opportunity to research the issues raised in the defense motions and since trial is in 2 1/2 weeks, the State is asking for adj. The DNA is not yet back from the State Crime Lab nor do they have the Sex Assault Nurse examination report.  The defense indicates that they are not waiving their speedy trial demand.

BTC: JT remains. The State's request is taking under advisement. The State must file their motions for false statements and prior sexual conduct by April 4

Defendant Shaun L Johnson in court with attorney Carl Johnson.  Defendant Shaun L Johnson in custody.  Rebecca Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
The State files a De Novo bond review due to the deft's bond being lowered. The State objected to the bond modification and asks the Court to review said motion. The State provides information regarding the case for the defendant in Florida citing no contact with victim KW.  Mr. Johnson notes the commissioner was aware of the information that the State has shared today. Mr. Johnson makes it clear that the defendant did not follow the victim here and the relationship is sort of on again/off again and asks that the bond remain as amended by the Commissioner. Mr. Johnson intends to file a speedy trial demand in this case.

BTC: bond is to remain as set with the addition of GPS. Defendant may go to court hearings, attorney visits and confirmed and verified employment
